page.title: 04EDUCATION Pentney & Narboro'
page.content: {Narborough First School}built in 1870, occupies a small site a quarter of a mile from the village. Children are admitted at about 4\ years of age and remain until after their 8th birthday. At present there are 56 children in three classrooms, two of which are mobile buildings, whilst the third is the original school. The majority of children live locally with 10 coming from Pentney in transport provided by the authority due to the closure of{Pentney school}in 1981. There are 3 teachers including the Head, with 6 ancillary staff. 12 children at present enjoy a cooked school meal whilst the rest bring a packed lunch. The aim is to formulate a balanced, lively, appropriate curriculum laying a wholesome foundation for future development.
